'''Kingler''' ([[List of Japanese Pokémon names|Japanese]]: '''キングラー''' ''Kingler'') is a {{type|Water}} {{OBP|Pokémon|species}} introduced in [[Generation I]].

It [[Evolution|evolves]] from {{p|Krabby}} starting at [[level]] 28.

==Biology==
Kingler is a crustacean Pokémon resembling a crab. Its strong shell covers the outside of its body, featuring a red upper-half, and a light tan lower-half. Its upper half is topped with six tall, thin spikes that resemble a crown. Its lower half doubles as its jaw with six fangs overlapping its upper body. Its two outer fangs are much larger than the inner two, and are roughly half as tall as Kingler's entire body. Its hips are visibly protruding from its lower body connecting its long, thin legs with claw-like feet. Kingler's main feature is its red claws. Its left claw is roughly twice as large as the other and hard as steel.

Kingler is often found on the {{DL|List of Pokémon by habitat|Water's-edge Pokémon|edges of water}}, usually the ocean. It has been observed using its powerful claws to pry open the shells of {{p|Shellder}} and {{p|Cloyster}}. While Kingler's large, left claw is it main tool for offensive maneuvers, it is so large and heavy that Kingler can barely lift it. It causes balancing problems and Kingler may quickly become fatigued from continuous use. However, it has been shown to communicate with other Kingler by waving its pincers around.

==In the anime==
[[File:Kingler BW087.png|250px|thumb|Kingler in the {{pkmn|anime}}]]
===Major appearances===
====[[Ash's Kingler]]====
{{Ash}}'s {{p|Krabby}} evolved into a Kingler in ''[[EP075|Round One - Begin!]]'', during Ash's first round battle in the [[Indigo Plateau Conference]].

====Other====
A Kingler appeared in ''[[EP063|The Battle of the Badge]]'', under the ownership of {{an|Giovanni}}. He used it in his Gym battle against {{Gary}}'s {{TP|Gary|Arcanine}}. Despite the type disadvantage, Giovanni's Kingler was defeated. He also leant it to [[Jessie]], [[James]], and {{MTR}} when he put them in charge of the [[Viridian Gym]]. Kingler managed to put Ash's Bulbasaur on the back foot, but was driven off by Pikachu.

A Kingler appeared in ''[[BW087|Expedition to Onix Island!]]''.

===Minor appearances===
Kingler debuted in ''[[EP042|Showdown at Dark City]]'' as one of the {{DL|Gym|Kaz Gym}}'s Pokémon.

A Kingler appeared in ''[[EP052|Princess vs. Princess]]'' competing in the [[Princess Festival|Queen of the Princess Festival contest]].

A Kingler appeared in ''[[M01|Mewtwo Strikes Back]]''.

A Kingler was among the Pokémon controlled by [[Cassidy]] and [[Butch]] in ''[[EP086|Pikachu Re-Volts]]''.

A Kingler appeared in {{OBP|Marina|EP091}}'s fantasy in ''[[EP091|Bye Bye Psyduck]]''.

A {{pkmn|Trainer}}'s Kingler was treated by [[Nurse Joy]] in ''[[EP092|The Joy of Pokémon]]''.

A Kingler appeared in ''[[EP169|Beauty and the Breeder]]'', where it participated in [[Pokémon Beauty Contest|a Pokémon breeding competition]].

A Kingler was one of the Pokémon living at [[Temacu]]'s father's lab in ''[[EP198|The Heartbreak of Brock]]''.

A Kingler appeared in ''[[EP215|Octillery The Outcast]]'', under the ownership of a Trainer waiting in line to register for the [[Whirl Cup]].

Multiple Kingler appeared in ''[[M02|The Power of One]]'' and ''[[M09|Pokémon Ranger and the Temple of the Sea]]''.

A Kingler appeared in ''[[DP089|Up Close and Personable!]]''.

==In the manga==
[[File:Kingler PM.png|thumb|200px|Kingler in [[Pokémon Pocket Monsters]]]]
[[File:Harry Kingler Machop Adventures.png|thumb|left|200px|Kingler in [[Pokémon Adventures]]]]
===In the Pokémon Adventures manga===
In [[Pokémon Adventures]], Kingler is shown under the ownership of several {{tc|Team Rocket Grunt}}s, and one is later shown in a flashback during {{adv|Giovanni}}'s speech regarding experimented Pokémon that were shipped on the [[S.S. Anne]] under the owner ship of [[Team Rocket Trio|Harry]] in ''[[PS038|Long Live the Nidoqueen!?]]''.

In ''[[PS179|The Last Battle XIII]]'' A Kingler was one of the Pokémon sent to help the fight in [[Ilex Forest]].

Much later, in ''[[PS276|My, My, My Mimic]]'', another Kingler is shown having been captured by [[Carr]] to try to ambush {{adv|Red}} and {{adv|Blue}}, but it is frozen and beaten by the newly arrived [[Lorelei]].

===In the Pokémon Pocket Monsters manga===
{{TP|Red|Clefairy}} hooked a Kingler in ''[[PM006|Great Success in the Mountains or the Seas!?]]''. Another Kingler appeared in the chapter under the ownership of [[Lt. Surge]].

{{OBP|Red|Pocket Monsters}} obtained a Kingler in ''[[PM017|Regain the Deserted Power Plant!]]''.

===In The Electric Tale of Pikachu manga===
{{main|Ash's Kingler}}
Ash has a Kingler that he caught it off-screen. It was first seen defeating a Trainer in the Indigo League; it was later revealed that it evolved from a Krabby in doing so.

==Trivia==
* Kingler shares its {{pkmn|category}} name with {{p|Scizor}}. They are both known as the Pincer Pokémon, though Scizor was originally called the Scissors Pokémon.

===Origin===
Kingler is very similar to a {{wp|fiddler crab}} or a {{wp|terrestrial crab}} of the genus ''{{wp|Cardisoma}}'', which usually have one claw larger than the other. Conceptually, it is likely based on a {{wp|king crab}}.

====Name origin====
Kingler may be a combination of ''{{wp|King crab|king}}'' and ''{{wp|Fiddler crab|fiddler}}'', both of which are species of {{wp|crab}}. It may also be a combination of "king" and "angler".
